results.title: Night Moves
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Sherman and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays private detective Harry Moseby who is hired by an ex- actress to find her teenage runaway daughter. Moseby’s hunt for the missing teenager takes him deep into mystery, double-cross, violence and smuggling. A homage to film-noir, “Night Moves” is also a bleak, stylish examination of alienation and greed in contemporary America.

results.title: Night ferry
results.creator_credit: CFF Productions, Eady-Barnes Productions and David Eady
results.brief_description: Childrens mystery adventure film about the son of a cafe owner who investigates the theft of an Egyptian mummy. Cast includes Bernard Cribbins, Graham Fletcher, Jayne Tottman, Engin Ashref, Carol Rousseau, Aubrey Morris.

results.title: Night falls on Manhattan
results.creator_credit: Spelling Films, Thom Mount, Josh Kramer and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: Sean Casey (Andy Garcia), a cop turned lawyer is landed the coveted position of D.A. when he wins a highly publicised case that resulted in the death of 3 police officers and the serious wounding of Casey’s father, also a policeman. The case is marked by dirty cops and corruption and as Casey begins his new appointment he discovers that truth was not really the victor during the trail, but was justice and honesty served? Casey must decide on a balance between the confusing concepts of truth, honesty, justice, loyalty and morality. Based on the novel, “Tainted evidence” by Robert Daley. Cast also includes Ian Holm, Lena Olin and Paul Guilfoyle.

results.title: Night children
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Julian Biggs and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: The story of a case worker with a Children’s Aid Society and the children she helps. Working round the clock, the Society receives appeals of every sort. The film shows how the Society follows through in the case of a little girl found wandering alone on downtown streets at night and in other cases of children abandoned, uncared for, the victims of their environment.

results.title: Night and fog = Nuit et brouillard
results.brief_description: Commissioned to mark the tenth anniversary of the concentration camps’ liberation, “Nuit et Brouillard” (English title “Night and Fog”)is one of the most respected documentaries in world cinema. From the post-war ruins of Auschwitz, seen in elegiac colour, to its horrifying past, recorded in stark black and white, Resnais’ film pursues the question which still haunts us today: do we share the guilt for those deported, tortured and killed? Jean Cayrol’s moving commentary challenges us not to forget, to “look around and hear people crying endlessly?” For a few hours, the film wipes out the memory of all other films. It must be seen. Features photography by two of France’s most renowned cinematographers, Ghislain Cloquet and Sacha Vierny. Music by Hanns Eisler, assistant director Chris Marker.

results.title: Night and day
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Arthur Schwartz and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: The spectacular musical biography of one of this century’s greatest composers - Cole Porter. Cary Grant portrays Cole Porter and Night and Day shows the popular songwriter’s amazing life story - from studying law at Yale, his bravery in World War I, his romance with Linda Lee to his first Broadway success. Features the evergreen hit songs “Begin the Beguine”, “I Get a Kick Out of You”, “My Heart Belongs to Daddy” and “Let’s fall in love.” Starring Cary Grant and Alexis Smith. Co-starring Monty Woolley, Ginny Simms, Jane Wyman and Mary Martin.

results.title: Night's High Noon: an anti-terrain
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Created amidst Australia’s 1988 Bicentenary celebrations, ‘Night’s High Noon’ proposed a flipside to stereotyped notions of recent Australian history and identity. For Australia’s Aboriginal peoples the Bicentenary represented 200 years of dispossession from their land, cultural destruction and racial prejudice. Representations of indigenous cultures allude to the appropriation and objectification of Aboriginal peoples, their artforms and traditions, in white Australian popular culture. Truth and Meaning are similarly problematised.

Produced with the assistance of the Australian Film Commission.
Notes by Rachel Kent, reprinted courtesy of the author and d/Lux Media Arts.

results.title: Nigeria: giant in Africa
results.brief_description: This vivid recounting of Nigeria’s history, from pre-European times to the mid-20th century, provides dramatic background to the political maturing of Africa’s most populous country. Of particular interest is the film’s treatment of ancient African cultures as revealed in the three regions that make up the Federation of Nigeria.
